Class Board

java.lang.Object
ijae.xgalead00.Board
public class Board extends Object
Represents the game board.

Handles loading levels from external text files, storing the tile layout, and managing entities (player and ghosts) on the board.

  • Method Details

    • loadLevel

      public void loadLevel(String path) throws IOException
      Loads a level from a given file path.

      Reads the board dimensions and tiles, and initializes the player and ghosts. The player's key collection triggers ghosts to become enraged.

      Parameters:
      path - path to the external level file (e.g., "custom_levels/custom1.txt")
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be read or does not exist

    • IsAccessible

      public boolean IsAccessible(int x, int y)
      Checks if the tile at the specified coordinates is accessible for movement.
      Parameters:
      x - tile column
      y - tile row
      Returns:
      true if accessible, false otherwise

    • getTile

      public Tiles getTile(int x, int y)
      Returns the tile at the specified coordinates. If out of bounds, returns a WALL tile.
      Parameters:
      x - tile column
      y - tile row
      Returns:
      the tile at (x, y)

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Returns:
      the player entity on the board

    • getGhosts

      public List<Ghost> getGhosts()
      Returns:
      list of ghosts on the board

      public int getRows()
      Returns:
      number of rows in the board

    • getCols

      public int getCols()
      Returns:
      number of columns in the board

      public Tiles[][] getTiles()
      Returns:
      the 2D array of tiles

    • getTileWidth

      public int getTileWidth()
      Returns:
      width of each tile in pixels

    • getTileHeight

      public int getTileHeight()
      Returns:
